headline: FirstEnergy’s Pennsylvania Default Service Program DSP-VI Auctions: Information Session for Prospective Bidders on Wednesday, February 4, 2026
summary: BOSTON, February 03, 2026--CRA International, Inc. (NASDAQ: CRAI), a worldwide leader in providing economic, financial, and management consulting services, today announced that an auction process will be conducted for FirstEnergy Pennsylvania Electric Company (FE PA) to procure full requirements Default Supply generation service for their Default Service Customers. The auction process will lead up to the auctions scheduled for April 7, 2026.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider FirstEnergy (FE) After Its 1-Year 22% Share Price Gain?
summary: If you are wondering whether FirstEnergy's current share price reflects its true worth, you are not alone. This article is designed to help you weigh what you are paying against what you might be getting. FirstEnergy recently closed at US$46.99, with returns of 0.5% over the last 7 days, 3.8% over the last 30 days, 3.8% year to date, 22.4% over 1 year, 32.8% over 3 years, and 77.6% over 5 years. This naturally raises questions about how much value is already priced in and how much risk the...

headline: FirstEnergy Bill Credits In Maryland Highlight Regulatory And Growth Balancing Act
summary: Potomac Edison, a FirstEnergy (NYSE:FE) subsidiary, will distribute automatic bill credits to over 247,000 Maryland residential customers. The credits are part of Maryland's Legislative Energy Relief Refund program, aimed at easing rising energy costs. Customers receive the relief directly on their bills without needing to apply for the program. For you as an investor, this ties directly to how a regulated utility like FirstEnergy operates, balancing customer affordability with regulatory...
